citations.narrative:
* Twenty one goats, One camel, One bovine calf, Sixteen rabbits, One silver fox, Two cavy's and Two artic foxes were
missing from the animal on hand records. Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each animal's identity
can be known with certainty, to be able to trace all animals and to facilitate the inspection process. The applicant shall
make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning all
animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
* There was no signed enrichment program by the veterinarian of record for one single housed spider monkey.
Enrichment of there environment is needed to ensure that the basic needs of all primates are being met. Special
consideration for enrichment of there environment is especially important when a primate is being single housed with no
other contact with other primates. The applicant must have a signed copy of the enrichment of the environment from there
veterinarian for all single housed primates.

* One water receptacle has an algae looking substance on the interior surface of the water receptacle. Four Cavy's are in
contact with the affected receptacles located in an outdoor enclosure. When the water becomes contaminated, it is no
longer considered to be safe to be consumed and could lead to potential health risks. Algae buildup in the receptacle
indicates a lack of cleaning is occurring on a regular basis. Clean water receptacles are important to promote good health
to the animals and reduce the risk of disease The applicant must ensure all water receptacles must be kept clean and
sanitary.

* A mixture of dust, cobwebs and excreta droppings were observed in one outdoor building housing two foxes and four
cavy's. This indicates a living area exists for rodents, other pests and other vermin. Unsanitary living conditions are
created if this outdoor building is not kept clean and this could lead to health issues for the cavy's and foxes. The
applicant must ensure that all buildings and surrounding grounds are kept clean to facilitate required husbandry practices.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 12, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
* Twenty one goats, One camel, One bovine calf, Sixteen rabbits, One silver fox, Two cavy's and Two artic foxes were 
missing from the animal on hand records. Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each animal's identity 
can be known with certainty, to be able to trace all animals and to facilitate the inspection process. The applicant shall 
make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning all 
animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control. 
3.81(c)(4) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
* There was no signed enrichment program by the veterinarian of record for one single housed spider monkey. 
Enrichment of there environment is needed to ensure that the basic needs of all primates are being met. Special 
consideration for enrichment of there environment is especially important when a primate is being single housed with no 
other contact with other primates. The applicant must have a signed copy of the enrichment of the environment from there 
veterinarian for all single housed primates. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
* One water receptacle has an algae looking substance on the interior surface of the water receptacle. Four Cavy's are in 
contact with the affected receptacles located in an outdoor enclosure. When the water becomes contaminated, it is no 
longer considered to be safe to be consumed and could lead to potential health risks. Algae buildup in the receptacle 
indicates a lack of cleaning is occurring on a regular basis. Clean water receptacles are important to promote good health 
to the animals and reduce the risk of disease The applicant must ensure all water receptacles must be kept clean and 
sanitary. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
* A mixture of dust, cobwebs and excreta droppings were observed in one outdoor building housing two foxes and four 
cavy's. This indicates a living area exists for rodents, other pests and other vermin. Unsanitary living conditions are

created if this outdoor building is not kept clean and this could lead to health issues for the cavy's and foxes. The 
applicant must ensure that all buildings and surrounding grounds are kept clean to facilitate required husbandry practices. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 12, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
